intro: Amberboa bollei, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has a low, sprawling growth habit with succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access moisture from underground water sources. Amberboa bollei plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing sandy soils.
